Show Solution
(a) There is one 5 in a six-sided die. Thus, n(E) = 1 and n(S) = 6.
(b) There are three even numbers in a six-sided die, that is (2, 4, 6). Thus, n(E) = 3 and n(S) = 6.
(c) Recall that a prime number is a natural number whose only factors are 1 and itself. So, there are three prime numbers in a six-sided die, that is {2, 3, 5}. Thus, n(E) = 3 and n(S) = 6.
(d) There are four numbers that are factors of 6, that is {1, 2, 3, 6}. Thus, n(E) = 4 and n(S) = 6.

(e) A composite number is a natural number or a positive integer that has more than two factors. For example, 15 has factors 1, 3, 5, and 15, hence it is a composite number. Of this definition of a composite number, there is only one number in a six-sided die which has more than two factors, that is 6 (has factors 1, 2, 3, and 6). Thus, n(E) = 1 and n(S) = 6.

The total balls in the bag = x orange balls + 4 purple balls + (x + 2) yellow balls
= x + 4 (x + 2)
= 2x + 6

To get the value of x, we can use the probability of an orange as a hint.

Therefore,

number of orange balls: x = 3
number of yellow balls: 2x + 6 = 2(3) + 6 = 6 + 6 = 12
(a) There are 4 purple balls out of 19 balls. Thus, n(E) = 4 and n(S) = 19.
(b) There are 12 yellow balls out of 19 balls. Thus, n(E) = 12 and n(S) = 19.
